revised_title: Morphological and Taxonomic Analysis of Trypanosomes Causing Dourine
tldr: The authors examine three strains of Trypanosoma equiperdum, the parasite causing dourine, and find significant morphological differences between them. Strain A exhibits a higher number of short, aflagellar forms and posterior nuclear forms compared to strains B and C, leading to a reconsideration of the nomenclature and classification of these parasites.
